de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep
Class AbstractBigStepProofRule

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.AbstractProofRule
      de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep.AbstractBigStepProofRule
All Implemented Interfaces:
BigStepProofRule, ProofRule, Comparable<ProofRule>
abstract class AbstractBigStepProofRule
extends AbstractProofRule
implements BigStepProofRule

Abstract base class for implementations of the BigStepProofRule interface.

Version:
$Rev: 415 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
BigStepProofRule, AbstractProofRule

Constructor Detail

AbstractBigStepProofRule

AbstractBigStepProofRule(int group,
                         String name)
Allocates a new AbstractBigStepProofRule of the specified name.

Parameters:
group - the group id of this big step rule, see the description of the AbstractProofRule.getGroup() for details.
name - the name of the big step proof rule to allocate.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if name is null.
See Also:
AbstractProofRule#AbstractProofRule(String)
Method Detail

apply

public void apply(BigStepProofContext context,
                  BigStepProofNode node)
           throws ProofRuleException
Applies this big step proof rule to the specified node via the given context.

Specified by:
apply in interface BigStepProofRule
Parameters:
context - the big step proof context via which the application of this rule to the node should be performed.
node - the big step proof node to which to apply this rule.
Throws:
ProofRuleException - if this rule cannot be applied to the node.
NullPointerException - if either context or node is null.

update

public void update(BigStepProofContext context,
                   BigStepProofNode node)
Updates the specified node as part of a previous rule application for context. This method is only interesting for non-axiom rules, like (APP) or (LET), that need to update their created proof nodes even after applications of other proof rules to subtrees. This method is only invoked for proof nodes that are not already proven (see ProofNode.isProven()). If node is proven, this represents a bug in the big step proof model logic.

Specified by:
update in interface BigStepProofRule
Parameters:
context - the main proof context, which was previously specified as parameter to an apply(BigStepProofContext, BigStepProofNode) invokation on another proof node, possibly with another proof rule.
node - the BigStepProofNode that may need to be updated.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if context or node is null.

applyInternal

protected abstract void applyInternal(BigStepProofContext context,
                                      BigStepProofNode node)
                               throws Exception
Abstract internal apply method, implemented by the AbstractBigStepProofRuleSet class while registering new proof rules.

Parameters:
context - see apply(BigStepProofContext, BigStepProofNode).
node - see apply(BigStepProofContext, BigStepProofNode).
Throws:
Exception - if an error occurs while applying the rule to the node using the context.
See Also:
apply(BigStepProofContext, BigStepProofNode)

updateInternal

protected abstract void updateInternal(BigStepProofContext context,
                                       BigStepProofNode node)
                                throws Exception
Abstract internal update method, implemented by the AbstractBigStepProofRuleSet class while registering new proof rules.

Parameters:
context - see update(BigStepProofContext, BigStepProofNode).
node - see update(BigStepProofContext, BigStepProofNode).
Throws:
Exception - if an error occurs while updating the node using the context.

newNoopRule

static BigStepProofRule newNoopRule(String name)
Allocates a new BigStepProofRule with the specified name, that does nothing, meaning that apply(BigStepProofContext, BigStepProofNode) and update(BigStepProofContext, BigStepProofNode) are noops.

Parameters:
name - the name of the rule to allocate.
Returns:
a newly allocated BigStepProofRule with the specified name, that does nothing.
See Also:
toExnRule(int)

toExnRule

BigStepProofRule toExnRule(int n)
Translates this big step proof rule to an appropriate exception rule, with the given sub node index n. For example, for (APP), this generates (APP-EXN-n).

Parameters:
n - the index of the sub node, starting at 0.
Returns:
the new BigStepProofRule for the exception.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative.
